meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of several countries in the Middle East and North Africa.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, people use the dinar to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for dinars before traveling to Tunisia.
meanings.sent3: The dinar rolled off the table and into the piggy bank with a clink.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a thousand dinars.
meanings.sent5: The shiny dinar sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A gold coin formerly used in countries of the Middle East.
meanings.sent1: My grandfather showed me a dinar from his collection of old coins.
meanings.sent2: Merchants in ancient markets often traded goods for dinars.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun offered a magical dinar in exchange for a wish.
meanings.sent4: His words were as valuable as a rare dinar, treasured by all who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The dinar gleamed like a tiny sun, radiating warmth and wealth.
